2004's 13 going on 30 is another example
of the birthday wish fulfillment
subgenre jenna rank is a geeky teen in
1994 when she's humiliated by her
friends during her 13th birthday locked
in a closet jenna wishes that she could
fast forward and wake up as the 30 year
old magazine editor she's dreamt of
being one day well she gets her wish and
the added bonus is that she wakes up in
jennifer garner's body but unlike some
other examples on this list jenna's path
to adulthood was not overnight instead
her consciousness had been zapped
forward a decade ignore all the
authority metaphysical implications
about fatalism and free will and you're
left with a super fun rom-com that
tapped into a generation of female fans
desire for autonomy success and material
luxuries 13 going on 30 features a
number of performances by future mcu
actors besides that big hulking green
guy is a grown-up version of jenna's shy
crush there's andy circus as her boss at
the fashion magazine boys judy greer as
her backstabbing childhood bestie turned
assistant editor and even a blink and
you'll miss it cameo from a young
captain marvel with brie larson in a
non-speaking role as one of the mean
girls who torments jenna in the 1990s
the irony here is that jennifer garner
herself has never been in an mcu movie
despite starring in both marvel's
daredevil and elektra can we get jen
into something please to prepare for the

b allen and powder so impressive that

the fact wrong are we really that old

as the godmother transforms cinderella's

gown but the true magic trick happened
behind the scenes after a decade of box

cinderella was the final gamble walt
disney could make before he went totally
bankrupt to save time and money the
studio shot a majority of the film in
live action first for animators to
replicate later and well the rest is
history literally cinderella brought
disney's golden age of animation to a
close and ushered in a new era where
subsequent films were produced less
artistically and more with an eye
towards commercial and financial success
this changing of the guard was mirrored
by the studio replacing sleeping
beauty's castle for cinderellas as both
the company's logo and flagship location
at the heart of its newest theme park
disney world which opened in 1970.
